description.narrative: IFC will support Kasada Hospitality Fund LP (Kasada) by providing loan financing for its first phase capital deployment, which targets the establishment of a portfolio of up to 20 hotels (estimated 4,000 hotel keys) requiring a total investment (debt and equity) of approximately US$400 million. Kasadas own capital deployment and the related IFC loans will be structured as discrete sub-projects, each of which will be progressively reviewed by IFC and will be subject to standardized investment criteria. The first such sub-project is Project Ayaba (Ayaba) and subsequent sub-projects are expected to align with Ayaba in terms of the proposed financial arrangements. Project Ayaba comprises Kasadas acquisition of 8 existing Accor-managed hotels (run under the Pullman, Novotel and Ibis brands) in Abidjan, Cote dIvoire (4 hotels); Dakar, Senegal (3 hotels) and Douala, Cameroon (1 hotel); operating liquidity injections to ensure the functioning of the hotels in the COVID-19 pandemic environment; and capital expenditure to refurbish/improve the properties and to achieve higher operating efficiencies.

The most significant expected project-level outcome is to provide hotels in distress due to impact of the COV-19 pandemic, and acquired in the previaling environment from a liquidity-constrained non-strategic investor, with additional liquidity and operational support to facilitate necessary restructuring and recapitalization leading to successful turnarounds, and consequently job preservation in the hospitality sector and its supply chain. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater sector integration by making financing more accessible to hotels in Sub-Saharan Africa, including those in distressed situations, via support for the first large-scale, professionally managed equity fund focused on hospitality, which plans to build a significant portfolio of hotels in SSA.
